agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support services and social activities for youth and adults who are recovering from substance use.

site_eligibility: Individuals who need recovery from anything such as grief, mental health, incarceration, parenting, divorce, finance, etc.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support services and social activities for youth and adults who are recovering from substance use.
service_description: Provides 9-bed recovery home for women struggling with substance use. Program is six months, but length of stay can be up to one year.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website to complete the pre-application. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- Struggling with substance use

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that
service_description: Provides transitional housing for women in recovery from substance use. Program teaches responsibility, self-care, general life skills, tools for employment, and recovery options. Minimum stay is six months with the option to stay longer. Home houses up to nine women at one time.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website to complete an online application. -- Call for information or assistance.
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- In recovery from substance use

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or email for appointment or information.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A commerical utility company providing electricity and telecommunication services, water, wastewater and products.
service_description: Provides electric utility service in Hancock and parts of Hamilton, Madison, and Rush counties.
site_details: Call or walk in to start service. -- Bills can be paid in person, by mail, phone, or online; a drop box is located at this site.
site_schedule: Customer Service: Mon-Fri 7:30am-5pm; Sat 8am-noon -- Toll-Free: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commerical utility company providing electricity and telecommunication services, water, wastewater and products.
service_description: Provides discounted landline phone services to households in the NineStar service area who receive public assistance or are below 135% of Federal Poverty Level. Lifeline provides a monthly discount on basic local telephone service and waiver of line connection fee.
site_details: Call for information or to have an application mailed.
site_eligibility: Meets income eligibility guidelines (and/or households receiving SSI, SNAP/food stamps,   Medicaid/Hoosier Healthwise, Section 8, TANF, IMPACT, Veteran Pension or survivor pension -- Household not receiving Lifeline assistance for any other phone line, including   cell service -- Service must be for applicant's primary residence and billed in applicant's name

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a supplemental supply of food to those in need.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_schedule: Mon 1pm-2:30pm and 5:30pm-6:30pm; Tues 9am-10:30am and 6pm-7pm; Wed and Thurs 7pm-8pm
site_eligibility: Living in Hancock County -- At or below 185% of Federal Poverty Guidelines -- Limit two visits per month

agency_desc: The Salvation Army, an international movement, is an evangelical part of the universal Christian church. Its message is based on the Bible. Its ministry is motivated by the love of God. Its mission is to preach the gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.
service_description: Provides short-term emergency assistance for persons in crisis and living in Hancock County. Based on funding, assistance may be available for rent, mortgage, non-narcotic prescriptions, propane, and utility bills for electric, gas, or water. Assistance is limited to twice per calendar year.
site_details: Call and leave a voicemail with contact information with needed assistance for a return call.
site_eligibility: Open -- Have not already received assistance 2 times within the current calendar year from this agency

site_name: COMMUNITY SCHOOL CORPORATION OF SOUTHERN HANCOCK COUNTY
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. agency_desc: A county agency that maintains an animal shelter, responds to reports of stray or neglected animals, and offers pet adoptions. This department enforces animal-related ordinances and works with the community to promote responsible pet ownership.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in Hancock County, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and found services, microchipping of pets, humane euthanasia for terminally ill pets, adoption for homeless dogs and cats, and educates the public about the responsibilities of pet ownership.
site_details: Walk in during kennel hours for adoptions, lost-and-found, microchipping, or owner surrenders/euthanasia. -- Call for information or to make a report. -- For after-hours emergencies, call Animal Control Dispatch.
site_eligibility: Living in Hancock County

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need.
site_details: Drive up to the east entrance.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Accepts properly contained used needles and syringes for disposal. This service is available at no charge to persons living in Hancock County. Containers are not provided.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers prenatal vitamins at no cost for pregnant Hancock County women with proof of pregnancy.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open -- Pregnant

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older -- Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides HPV (human papillomavirus) immunizations for young people 11-26 years old.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Ages 11-26

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect health and safety in Hancock County. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air and water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Open

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An incorporated nonprofit agency which "strives to eradicate domestic and sexual violence through education, prevention, and intervention in Central Indiana." Alternatives Inc. supports survivors through the initial crisis with the ultimate strategy of helping them achieve abuse-free and financially independent lives.
service_description: Provides assistance and crisis response to survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, and human trafficking. Services include court accompaniment, assistance filing a protective order, advocacy, and case management. Can assist with arranging emergency transportation from Hancock County to the shelter in Anderson for survivors and their dependents who have been accepted into the shelter.
site_details: For immediate assistance call the crisis hotline. For all other inquiries call, email, visit website, or Facebook page for assistance. www.alternativesdv.org / www.facebook.com/AlternativesIncDV
site_eligibility: Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, or human trafficking with or without dependents living or working in Hancock County

agency_desc: A nonprofit network of hospitals and other health and medical services providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bipolar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Central Intake to schedule an assessment. For crisis intervention, call the Crisis Line.
site_eligibility: Age 5 and older -- In need of outpatient mental health services (based on assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable homes  for and alongside qualified, first time home buyers.
service_description: Sells donated building supplies, used appliances, and other home items to the general public at a discount. Donations accepted during store hours or by arrangement. Pick-up is available within set boundaries.
site_details: Call to see if a particular item is available or walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; arrive by 3:30pm to apply for marriage license
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; arrive by 3:30pm to apply for marriage license
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Hancock County

agency_desc: A county department that promotes integrated solid waste management through recycling, pollution prevention and reuse in Hancock County.
service_description: Provides a 24-hour drop-off site for recycling paper and cardboard. This agency offers information on Hancock County recycling events and proper waste disposal.
site_details: Walk in to drop off paper or cardboard for recycling; call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A county department that promotes integrated solid waste management through recycling, pollution prevention and reuse in Hancock County.
service_description: Accepts hazardous waste materials for proper disposal such as oil-based paints, pesticides, herbicides, car fluids and other hazardous materials. Electronics, latex paint, tires, and document shredding are also accepted. Donations are accepted for shoes (of any condition, style, or size) and expired nonperishable food items. Collection occurs twice per year.
site_details: Visit the website for collection events.
site_eligibility: Hancock County households (no businesses)

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties in the town of Fortville in Hancock County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Fortville in Hancock County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Hancock County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Fortville in Hancock County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.

site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of New Palestine

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Greenfield in Hancock County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations for the city of Greenfield and Center Township of Hancock County. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of Greenfield and Center Township in Hancock County

agency_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF HANCOCK COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency helping residents maintain an independent lifestyle through the delivery of nutritious meals in accordance with prescribed dietary needs and provide a point of personal contact with the community.
site_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF HANCOCK COUNTY
service_description: Provides a hot lunch and a cold evening meal each weekday to home-bound individuals who are unable to cook for themselves. Clients may also request one or two extra cold meals be delivered on Friday for the weekend. A physician's prescription for diet approval is required. Regular and special diets are available. Also offers volunteer opportunities.
site_details: Call to enroll or visit the website to complete an application.
site_eligibility: Physician's prescription (No age or income restrictions)

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Hancock County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.  Offers sandbags to Hancock County households during times of flooding.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Hancock County dispatch. -- For sandbags during times of flooding, be prepared to fill and haul sandbags. Call in advance.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Hancock County)

agency_name: LOVE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST - GREATER HANCOCK COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency with a mission to mobilize local churches to transform lives and communities.
site_name: LOVE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST OF GREATER HANCOCK COUNTY
service_description: Matches persons in need of assistance in Hancock County with volunteer programs through partnering churches. Depending on available resources, assistance may be provided for handyman services, light housekeeping/yard work, errands/shopping, moving assistance, and appliance repair. Wheelchair ramp construction, food, clothing, diapers, furniture (including baby furniture), appliances, hygiene products, and limited financial assistance with rent and utilities may also be available through partnering ministries. Limited service area.
site_details: Call for phone assessment to determine eligibility. -- Messages left after-hours will be returned the following business day.
site_eligibility: Living in Hancock County -- In need of services/assistance that partnering ministries may offer, as determined by phone assessment

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Hancock County.
service_description: Maintains the Hancock County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Hancock County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Hancock County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Hancock County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information contact the clerk.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the county Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Hancock County Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $10,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500.
site_details: Call, walk in or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Hancock County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Hancock County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Hancock County

agency_desc: A community organization providing meals yearly on Thanksgiving day.
service_description: Provides a community-wide,  carry-out Thanksgiving meal in Hancock County. Carryout, and delivery available. Persons in need may also request grocery delivery.
site_details: Call to place a meal request for dine in or to request delivery.
site_eligibility: Open -- Meal delivery boundaries - Marion County Eastside, West boundary is Emerson, South boundary is Thompson, and North boundary is 75th Street.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
